## âœ… Pre-submission Checklist

<!-- Check all that apply. You can check boxes after creating the PR. -->

### Code Quality
- [ ] My code follows the project's coding standards and style guidelines
- [ ] I have performed a self-review of my own code
- [ ] I have commented my code, particularly in hard-to-understand areas
- [ ] My changes generate no new warnings or errors
- [ ] I have removed any debug logs or commented-out code

### Testing
- [ ] I have added tests that prove my fix is effective or that my feature works
- [ ] New and existing unit tests pass locally with my changes
- [ ] I have tested the changes in a clean environment
- [ ] I have tested edge cases and error scenarios

### Documentation
- [ ] I have made corresponding changes to the documentation
- [ ] I have updated the README if needed
- [ ] I have added/updated inline code comments and docstrings
- [ ] I have updated the CHANGELOG (if applicable)

### Dependencies and Breaking Changes
- [ ] This change does not introduce new dependencies
  - [ ] If it does, I have justified the need and checked for security issues
- [ ] This change does not break existing functionality
  - [ ] If it does, I have clearly documented the breaking changes
- [ ] I have updated dependency versions if necessary

### Security and Performance
- [ ] My changes do not introduce security vulnerabilities
- [ ] I have considered the performance impact of my changes
- [ ] I have not hardcoded any sensitive information (credentials, API keys, etc.)

### Git and Commits
- [ ] My commits are atomic and have descriptive messages
- [ ] I have rebased my branch on the latest main (if needed)
- [ ] I have resolved any merge conflicts
